e4: Changing to the new policy enhances transparency and trust with investors, as it reflects true earnings without intentional bias. This shift mitigates the risk of legal repercussions and aligns the company with ethical financial practices. While some investors may initially misunderstand the change, over time, clear communication and education can foster a stronger relationship with all stakeholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, honesty, and accuracy in financial disclosures. It must provide clear and understandable information to investors, avoiding any intentional misrepresentation or bias. Relevant considerations include the potential impact on various stakeholders, the importance of maintaining trust in the market, and adhering to regulatory standards. Ethical policies seek to promote long-term sustainability and accountability, rather than short-term gains.
e6: Yes, I would ask for a detailed plan on how the transition to the new reporting policy will be communicated to investors and how we intend to address any concerns arising from misunderstandings. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to ensure ongoing investor education and feedback mechanisms to gauge investor sentiment during this transition.
